name: TC Contentful - modal component
description:
Challenge Objectives

  • Implement a modal component with modal trigger reusing existing codebase.

Project Background

Topcoder is utilizing Contentful (a headless CMS) to deliver high-quality content and provide a flexible platform to manage that content. In this challenge, you will help in the process by fulfilling the requirements listed below.

Technology Stack

NodeJS, Javascript, ReactJS, Contentful, CMS, Linux, Mac

Prerequisites

  • This challenge requires preregistered Contentful account

  • Linux or Mac based OS

Working on Contentful challenges

Before starting to work on the challenge please take some time to get familiar with the basics of setup, configuration, import/export of Contentful space and types. We have helpful documentation on the topics here.

 

To jumpstart the work process we have exports of TC community space here. Note that you will need to import “tc-core.json” which configures the core TC components in your space. It has all custom component types Topcoder is using.

 

The general preparation steps to work on Contentful related challenge are:

 

  1. Register your Contentful account and obtain/note its credentials.

  2. Import the TC custom types “tc-core.json” stored in the file to your space.

  3. Setup community-app locally. Some tips:

    1. Use node version 8.11.2

    2. Ask for help in TC Slack channels when some difficulties arise

  4. Provide Contentful credentials as environment variables to work against your space.

  5. Complete challenge requirements as per specification below.

  6. Test your work using the example routes `http://local.topcoder-dev.com:3000/examples/contentful/<:type>/<:id>`

  7. Export your space(via Contentful cli) to file and include it with submission.

 

Most core components do have mounted routes to ease the develop/test work with them. See this file for details.

General Requirements(All Major)

  • If You make changes to code it should pass project linting as configured. After your work `npm run lint` should complete without errors.

  • We should be able to import the export file(should be provided with submission) in TC Contentful space without any errors using the `contentful space import` command.

  • New developed components should be placed in the app’s contentful folder.

Individual Requirements(All Major)

  • Our markdown renderer supports custom tags that get rendered to components in runtime. We need to implement/add support for modal windows which get triggered by a click on text, button or icon embedded in the markdown. Therefore we need a new custom tag to be supported with the following structure:

<Modal id=”contentfulEntryId”><TEXT>|<BUTTON>|<ICON></Modal>

  • <Modal> should be a wrapper container component that will need to fetch the Contentful entry(and its children if needed) by the provided “contentfulEntryId” using the existing ContetfultLoader. When loaded then render the modal and its trigger binding a click/touch event on it. In other words, what is inside the <Modal> tag is the trigger’s HTML. Modal content itself is fetched from Contetful via its id.

  • The presentational modal component itself should reuse the Modal from topcoder-react-ui-kit. There are many examples in the codebase how to use it. For instance here. Check them and reuse accordingly. Actually, you need to just wrap what’s loaded form Contentful in the modal. Pseudocode is:

    • <Modal> container loads the entry(and its children) from Contentful via its id.

    • Wraps the loaded model in Modal component from topcoder-react-ui-kit.

    • Renders all children of the modal which themselves are also Contentful components. Those are restricted to viewport, banner or content block types. See how viewport wraps components for instance and reuses them. Modal should do same to reuse exisitng codebase not invent the weel.

  • See the modal model for details after importing  “tc-core.json”  in your space.

  • Your modal should have a X icon in the top right corner that closes it when clicked. The BaseModal supports closing when clicked on the overlay but does not has a close icon as it just wraps the provided content and renders it.

  • Ask in the forum for any hints and questions you have.

Testing the submission

It will be most easy to test your work by creating a content block embedding the modal functionality in your space and use the examples path to test. http://local.topcoder-dev.com:3000/examples/contentful/<:type>/<:id>

Please, demo modals with all 3 types of content. Banner, ContentBlock and Viewport.



Final Submission Guidelines

  • Patch to latest commit in develop branch of community-app.

  • Verification document with steps on how to verify your submission.

  • Deployment guide. Be specific!

name: Web Scraper Project 08 - Avoid Attack Detection
description:
CHALLENGE OBJECTIVES
  • Implement a configuration based strategy into the scraper to avoid attack detection from EC sites.
 
PROJECT BACKGROUND
The purpose of this project is to implement a web scraper that will extract the purchase history list from specified E-commerce (EC) Site.
The tool will be used by our client who owns representative EC site in Japan.
This is more of a PoC than a formal tool.
 
WORKFLOW
Right now the tool uses the standard com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.WebClient to send requests, now we want to extend it or encapsulate it to have better control on the scraping process so that it's harder for the EC sites to detect our scraping process.
  
DETAILED REQUIREMENTS
Please check Design_Flow_Control.pdf which we posted in the forum to better understand what we need to implement in this challenge. In summary this is what we want:
  1. Users will configure the contents of "tactics" which will be used by the scraper, the configuration will configure things like:
    1. Users range: the users the scraper will use to scrape EC sites
    2. User agent list
    3. Request Interval
    4. Request Interval Random (Yes / No), defaults to No
    5. Proxy Server
    6. Retry Interval
    7. Retry Trial Count
  2. The standard WebClient needs to be extended or encapsulated so that it will properly use these configured parameters:
    1. It will only use the configured users to scrape EC sites
    2. It will randomly pick one of the configured user agents in the request for a specific user
    3. It will wait for the configured request interval between consecutive requests, and if the request interval random flag is Yes, it will randomize the request interval a bit instead of using fixed request intervals
    4. It will use the configured Proxy Server in the standard way
    5. It will wait for the specified interval before each retry, and will only retry for the specified count
  3. Update the scraper to use this new extended or encapsulated WebClient instead of the standard one. Please note you do NOT have to extend the WebClient, you can also just encapsulate it with extra logic.
  4. It's ok if these tactics cannot be applyed to every single physical request, but try to apply them as much as possible.
  5. Please note only the web-scraper-server  folder needs to be updated.
 
REQUIREMENTS WEIGHT
Here's how we'd weight each of the requirements:
  1. Users range: the users the scraper will use to scrape EC sites (20%)
  2. User agent list (20%)
  3. Request Interval (10%)
  4. Request Interval Random (Yes / No), defaults to No (10%)
  5. Proxy Server (20%)
  6. Retry Interval (10%)
  7. RetryTrial Count (10%)
This should give you an idea about the priority of these requirements, and should also serve as a guide for review.

OPERATING SYSTEMS & BROWSERS
Linux / Mac OS / Windows
Must work on on Chrome / Firefox / Safari (Mac only)
IE support is NOT mandatory
 
DEVELOPMENT ASSETS
Base code
 
TECHNOLOGY STACK
JDK 8
Gradle 3.5
Spring Boot 1.5.7
MySQL
Vue.js

Final Submission Guidelines

FINAL DELIVERABLES
  • All original source code.
  • A detailed readme in markdown format explaining how to build, configure and deploy your code.
  • A detailed verification document in markdown format showing how to verify that your submission works properly (note: video based verification is NOT acceptable).

name: Topcoder Project Service - Improve DB/ES queries
description:
Replace several queries to a database with a single query to Elastic Search or Data Base.

Project Background

Topcoder Project Service is the main backend service of the Topcode Connect — client facing application of Topcoder.

We have two ways to retrieve a list of projects: from the Data Base and from the Elastic Search index. Both of these ways make 2 additional calls to the database which we want to avoid. In case of Elastic Search endpoints we want to completely avoid calling DB and get all the data from Elastic Search index with a single call. In case of Data Base endpoint, we want to replace 3 calls with 1 to avoid round trips from database to our server hosting.

Technology Stack

  • Node.js

  • PostgreSQL

  • ElasticSearch

Code access

The work for this challenge has to be done in one repository:
- Project Service repo https://github.com/topcoder-platform/tc-project-service branch dev commit 027039be5b7d307dbe799a61fe8dfa1a9a2b86fd or later.

Individual requirements

Avoid making 2 additional calls to DB and make only 1 call to ES

In the file https://github.com/topcoder-platform/tc-project-service/blob/feature/reviewed-projects-for-copilots/src/routes/projects/list.js we get a list of projects for current user from Elastic Search index. To do this we make 3 calls:
1. DB: Get a list of project IDs where a user is a member https://github.com/topcoder-platform/tc-project-service/blob/feature/reviewed-projects-for-copilots/src/routes/projects/list.js#L441

2. DB: Get a list of project IDs where a user is invited https://github.com/topcoder-platform/tc-project-service/blob/feature/reviewed-projects-for-copilots/src/routes/projects/list.js#L444-L452

3. ES: Get a list of projects using previously found IDs and other filter criteria https://github.com/topcoder-platform/tc-project-service/blob/feature/reviewed-projects-for-copilots/src/routes/projects/list.js#L463

Instead of making 2 additional calls to the DB (1 and 2) to retrieve projects IDs from DB, we want to update the last query to the ES so it gets all the projects user is a member or invited to.

NOTE: all other criteria/filters in this ES call should stay. We only want to combine 3 queries into one. And avoid calling DB as we can all the data directly from ES.

Combine 3 DB calls into 1

In the file https://github.com/topcoder-platform/tc-project-service/blob/feature/reviewed-projects-for-copilots/src/routes/projects/list-db.js we get a list of projects for current user from Data Base. To do this we make 3 calls:
1. DB: Get a list of project IDs where a user is a member https://github.com/topcoder-platform/tc-project-service/blob/feature/reviewed-projects-for-copilots/src/routes/projects/list-db.js#L136

2. DB: Get a list of project IDs where a user is invited

https://github.com/topcoder-platform/tc-project-service/blob/feature/reviewed-projects-for-copilots/src/routes/projects/list-db.js#L139-L147

3. DB: Get a list of projects using previously found IDs and other filter criteria

https://github.com/topcoder-platform/tc-project-service/blob/feature/reviewed-projects-for-copilots/src/routes/projects/list-db.js#L157

We want to combine all these 3 requests to the DB into one.
NOTE: all criteria/filters in this DB call should stay.

General requirements

Avoid $in or IN

Avoid $in or IN for list and list-db endpoints respectively.
The reason for this is because in ES there is a limit on max number of arguments 1024 we can pass into the $in.
For DB query we would like to avoid IN just to make the query similar to the one we would have for ES - as now list and list-db endpoints have similar code which makes it easier to support them.
The exception is for the filter query where we explicitly filter project by ids https://github.com/topcoder-platform/tc-project-service/blob/feature/reviewed-projects-for-copilots/src/routes/projects/list.js#L455 and https://github.com/topcoder-platform/tc-project-service/blob/feature/reviewed-projects-for-copilots/src/routes/projects/list-db.js#L149. For this filter it’s ok to use $in/IN.

Performance

Please, keep performance in mind. We are expecting that new queries would work faster than three separate queries.

Code quality

  • As these changes are inner all the unit tests should pass without tests changing.

  • Lint should pass.



Final Submission Guidelines

Patch to the Project Service branch dev commit 027039be5b7d307dbe799a61fe8dfa1a9a2b86fd or later.

name: Topcoder Project Service - Milestones limit
description:
Support a limit of possible milestones per timeline.

Project Background

Topcoder Project Service is the main backend service of the Topcode Connect — client facing application of Topcoder.

Each project may have several products and each product has a timeline with several milestones. At the moment for each product, we have a fixed quantity of milestones which is defined by Product Template. In the future, we want to let users adding more milestones, but we want to be able to control the maximum number of milestones which is possible to add to each product timeline based on Product Templates.

In this challenge, we are going to make changes on the backend side only.

Technology Stack

  • Node.js

  • PostgreSQL

  • ElastiSearch

Code access

The work for this challenge has to be done in one repository:
- Project Service repo https://github.com/topcoder-platform/tc-project-service dev branch

Individual requirements

  • Add metadata field to ProductTemplate model as { type: DataTypes.JSON, defaultValue: {}, allowNull: false }.

  • Add maxMilestones field to the Timeline model as { type: DataTypes.INTEGER, allowNull: true }.

  • Add a migration script to /migrations folder which will update DB according to changes in the models.

  • Update “create” Timeline endpoint:
    When we create a timeline we provide ProductTemplate to use for timeline creating
    - during Timeline creating we should populate the field maxMilestones using a value from metadata.maxMilestones of the used ProductTemplate (if the value is defined in ProductTemplate metadata).

  • Update “update” Timeline endpoint:
    Only users with admin rights should be able to update the maxMilestones.
    So when we update Timeline without changing maxMilestones - same permissions stay as now.
    But if somebody changes maxMilestones - we should additionally check if the user has admin permission, otherwise, don’t update Timeline and return an error with code 403: “Only admins can change ‘maxMilestones’.”.
    - Add 2 unit tests for “update” Timeline endpoint: tests should check the cases when we try to change the value of maxMilestones with a regular user and get an error, and when we change it with admin user successfully.

  • Update “create” Milestone endpoint:
    Each Milestone defines which Timeline it belongs to.
    - inside “create” Milestone endpoint, we should respect the value maxMilestones of according Timeline. So we cannot add more Milestones to a Timelines than it’s allowed. Otherwise, we should return an error with code 422: “Cannot add more than {maxMilestones} milestones to the timeline with id {timelineId}.”.
    - Note. Deleting a milestone would actually increase the quota of the milestones for the particular timeline i.e. if the timeline has already reached the max number of milestones, and then user deletes one of them, user can now add one more milestone.
    - Add unit tests for “create” Milestone endpoint: test should check the case when we try to add more milestones than it’s allowed and get an error.

General requirements

  • Update unit tests endpoints according to the changes where necessary

  • Update postman collection according to the changes where necessary

  • Update swagger according to the changes where necessary

  • Lint should pass

  • Existent unit tests should pass



Final Submission Guidelines

Patch to the dev branch of Project Service

name: Horizon Web - React Mock API Integration
description:
Challenge Objectives

  • Integrate the mock api to the Create New Project page
 

Project Background

 
Our customer is having an application which is used to manage credit deals. Current Application uses WPF  technology as a user interface which requires installation on each user machine. As a customer trying to centralize the application and would like to move towards HTML5 based solution, the presentation layer functionalities are moved to the new application.
 
  • We have already built the "Create New Project" page
  • This challenge we will integrate the mock api and fix all the logic.
 

Technology Stack 

  • ReactJS
  • NodeJS
  • Javascript
  • LESS
 

Individual Requirements


1. Integrate the mock API with the built UI. Please make it so it can be easily changed for the real API.

2. Fix the logic as described by the specification documentation found in forum

3. Additionally, fix the issues below:

S => Styling problems
L => Logic problems


3.1 API CALLS


- GetProjectFields API- The Client, Product Category, Product, Project Stage, Primary & Secondary Countries, and CS Role fields are some of the fields that dictate which fields get displayed in UI.The way the current fields are being displayed is with hardcoded logic rather than logic based on the API response.

- Client field- Is not doing an API call to search on clients.

- Product Category field- AllProdCategories must populate the field.. Fields that will be appearing in the following sections need to be based on the rules that come from the GetProjectFields API call and it should re populate the master data using Project References API.

- Product field- Product API  must populate the field.. Fields that will be appearing in the following sections need to be based on the rules that come from the GetProjectFields API call and it should re populate the master data using Project References API after product cat is selected.

- Project Stage field- must be populated from ProjectReferences. Fields that will be appearing in the following sections need to be based on the rules that come from the GetProjectFields API call and it should re populate the master data using Project References API after product / product cat is selected..

- Primary & Secondary Countries field- must be populated from ProjectReferences. Fields that will be appearing in the following sections need to be based on the rules that come from the GetProjectFields API call and it should re populate the master data using Project References API.

- CS Role field- Is not doing an API call. must be populated from ProjectReferences. Fields that will be appearing in the following sections need to be based on the rules that come from the GetProjectFields API call and it should re populate the master data using Project References API.

 

3.2 CLIENT DETAILS

The above is not shown to all users..  Should be based on GetProjectFields API

 

(L) 'CS Booking Entity' and 'Entity KYC Status' are on the form twice.

 

(L) Until the Product Category is chosen all the other sections are disabled and remain collapsed. On successful call to project reference data, the other sections are enabled and expanded except 'DEAL TEAM' section which can be expanded manually. At the moment, before the Product Category field is chosen you can expand and fill out the other sections. Also when it's filled in, the other sections don't expand.

 

(L) The "+ ADD ANOTHER  ENTITY" button should be disabled until either Legal Entity or Booking Entity value is selected. Currently you can click and use it with nothing in the fields once you add an additional entity instead of returning it to disabled. Also if you check the 'No client' button, if you uncheck it the button is re-enabled again.
 

(L) If user selects a legal entity from full selector, then any value selected in the ‘Client Legal Entity’ selector should be clear automatically. Currently it keeps the value in the Client Legal Entity form regardless of search.

 

 

This is not performing backend search

 

3.3 DEAL DETAILS

 

(L) When the user selects the 'Primary Country' the corresponding region has to be displayed next to the selected value. - At the moment, it doesn't display anything. The same thing is supposed to happen when the user selects the 'Secondary Country' except it replaces the 'OPTIONAL' with the corresponding region.

 

(L & S) The 'Does CS have a UKLA Sponsor role on this deal?' field/question isn't displaying when the Primary or Secondary Countries are the United Kingdom.  (for M&A, relates to GetProjectFields API)

 

(L & S) The ‘Project Linking’ field should be ‘Link to another CS Project’ and the field should be accepting a date.

 

(L & S) Add 'USD' to the side of the 'Pro-Rata Size' and 'Institutional Size' fields. Also, the values within the fields need to round off to 4 digits.

 

(L) 'Syndication Region' needs to be pre-populated with same region as client region.

 

(L) The 'CS Commitment Date' field should be Mandatory (removing the 'OPTIONAL' handle) when the Stage value changes to 'Solicitation - Prospect', 'Mandate/Execution...', or 'Completed'. Currently it doesn't remove the 'OPTIONAL' label when changed.

 

(L) The 'Date Completed' field shouldn't be visible if the form has an 'Estimated Closing Date' or 'CS Commitment Date' fields. It's currently showing it. Also the value should be populated with the value entered in the 'Estimated Closing Date' or 'CS Commitment Date' fields.

name: Hestia - Control Center API Definition Challenge
description:
Hestia is a wholesale distributor of a variety of plumbing and building-related products. Hestia Control Center will be an internal application that will help Hestia modernize their current spreadsheet process and allow their employees better access to data for reporting and analysis.

Requirements:
For this challenge, we want to build out a Swagger document for a REST API that will support the functionality in the Hestia Control Center.
Please NOTE: A Draft Listing Functionality is provided below, but please enrich the missing parts when you are checking the design.
 
Notes, all the following APIs should be based on user authorization

- Dashboard
  • List DB Schemas
  • List Tables per DB Schema
  • List Last Changes per Table
Improvement to think about: Can we support grouping APIs, so we can reduce the number of APIs in this page?

- Table Management (Host Deals), Notes, for table, columns and types are dynamic, please proper think if the APIs can support the table rendering and management freely.

General requirements

-- Be thorough but practical in the fields you are choosing - include fields for the most common and typical items, but don't go overboard. Use your judgment here.

-- Make sure your API is versioned.
-- Consistency - use REST standards and use a unified approach across your API
-- Make use of Swagger's model and object definitions and other "Don't repeat yourself" features.

name: TC Contentful duplicate tool
description:
Challenge Objectives

  • Develop NodeJS based CLI(command line) tool that recursively duplicates entries in/between Contentful spaces.

Project Background

Topcoder is utilizing Contentful (a headless CMS) to deliver high-quality content and provide a flexible platform to manage that content. With the growing content base and complexity of used components, we face the need of being able to duplicate content entry recursively. Means we want all children linked to the parent entry to duplicate with the entry as well. This challenge aims to create a useful tool for fulfilling this purpose.

Technology Stack

NodeJS, Javascript, ReactJS, Contentful, CMS, Linux, Mac

Prerequisites

  • This challenge requires a free Contentful account

  • Linux or Mac based OS

Working on Contentful challenges

Before starting to work on the challenge please take some time to get familiar with the basics of setup, configuration, import/export of Contentful space and types. We have helpful documentation on the topics here.

 

To jumpstart the work process we have exports of TC community space here. Note that you will need to import “tc-core.json” which configures the core TC components in your space. It has all custom component types Topcoder is using.

 

The general preparation steps to work on Contentful related challenge are:

 

  1. Register your Contentful account and obtain/note its credentials.

  2. Import the TC custom types “tc-core.json” stored in the file to your space.

  3. Setup community-app locally. Some tips:

    1. Use node version 8.11.2

    2. Ask for help in TC Slack channels when some difficulties arise

  4. Provide Contentful credentials as environment variables to work against your space.

  5. Complete challenge requirements as per specification below.

  6. Test your work using the example routes `http://local.topcoder-dev.com:3000/examples/contentful/<:type>/<:id>`

  7. Export your space(via Contentful cli) to file and include it with submission.

 

Most core components do have mounted routes to ease the develop/test work with them. See this file for details.

General Requirements(All Major)

  • If You make changes to code it should pass project linting as configured. After your work `npm run lint` should complete without errors.

  • We should be able to import the export file(should be provided with submission) in TC Contentful space without any errors using the `contentful space import` command.

  • New developed components should be placed in the app’s contentful folder.

Individual Requirements(All Major)

  • Use official Contentful SDK for JS to build a nodeJS based CLI tool that duplicates entries in/from a Contentful space recursively. Among duplicating the entry itself the tool should trace down recursively all linked child entries of it and duplicate them too.

  • When duplicating entries all their fields should be duplicated with their current values(sub-entries). Media fields should duplicate pointing to the original content. No media assets duplication is needed. Means for media fields just linking to the original asset is fine.

  • We need to be able to execute the tool with a single or array of entry IDs that will be duplicated.

  • Should be able to exclude entries. Means when entry ID is found in the tree but it is listed in excluded entries the tool should skip duplication and just link it. This is for reuse purposes(global components). 

  • The tool need to Implement also an argument parameter --single-level=true that when provided will force the tool to duplicate only the listed entries wihtout recursing them down the linked children. 

  • Tool need to support duplication in single space and between 2 spaces. For example in spaceA only and from spaceA to sapceB.

  • Tool need to support string replace/rename on titles of entries(name field). Some regex support which could be used to rename all duplicates with prefix/suffix or by some pattern.

  • The duplicated entries should be published by default but we need to have the option to duplicate as drafts. Therefore please add “publish=false” support with will duplicate but with draft status.

  • All types of TC core components should be supported for duplication by the tool.

  • Invoke the tool with --h should output some simple help how to use it.

  • The submission should be easy to publish to npm thus meet needed preparations.

 

 

Example invocation(pseudo) not mandatory. Your tool should be able to support it but could use different naming:

 

contentful-duplicate

--space-id=XXX

--mToken=OAuthManagementToken

--entries=XXX,XX2,XX3

[--exclude]=YYY,YY2

[--target-space-id]=XYZ

[--mToken-target]=OAuthManagementToken2

[publish]=false

Testing the tool

For testing, please demo the tool in action with > 5 level deep viewports of banners and content blocks. Duplicated entries should have a prefix on title [COPY].

References to help you kickstart development

https://contentful.github.io/contentful.js

https://www.contentful.com/developers/docs/javascript/example-apps/

https://www.contentful.com/developers/docs/references/content-management-api/

 


Final Submission Guidelines

  • The source code of the tool.

  • Exported file of your dev Contentful space.

  • Verification document with steps on how to verify your submission.

  • Deployment guide with simple help of the tool. Be specific!

name: Yaw Misalignment - Power BI Dashboard - Scatter Plot using R Script
description:
Challenge Objectives

Fix the scatter plot in the provided YAW PBI file using R-lang based scripting.

Project Background

The business objective is to optimize energy generation at each WTG by dynamic calculation of Yaw misalignment. We need a predictive model for dynamic calculation of Yaw misalignment at every 10 minutes rolling for next 90 days by using historical SCADA Data and calculate optimum value for the period.
 
In wind turbines, correct nacelle alignment to main wind direction is necessary for optimum generation and improve the annual energy production. Lot of analysis & reports says that 4 deg average will cause 1 % AEP loss
 
Ideally, Yaw offset should be zero degrees, but in a conservative way, business would like to keep the band within 0 to 2 degrees on either side.. The ultimate goal of this project is to optimize energy generation at each Wind Turbine Generator (WTG) by dynamic calculation of Yaw misalignment at every 10 min interval.

Individual Requirements

In the provided PBI file we need to plot Yaw column in the datasource as a scatter plot and plot the Optimal Yaw and Abs Single Yaw as lines on the scatter plot. Power BI is not providing this option, so we need to make use of R Scriping to plot the graph in PBI for these columns. 

Final Submission Guidelines

  • Fixed Power BI file
  • Steps to follow to setup preferably as a document
